general_advisory: Farmers are advised to conduct agricultural operations with proper care. Sowing of green fodder should be advised in moist soil. Keep crop fields free from weeds to minimize diseases and pests. Regular monitoring for pests and diseases recommended. Termites, sucking pests, diseases like powdery mildew, fusarium wilt, leaf hoppers, and mealy bugs should be managed with appropriate measures.

advisory: Gundi Bug Management - Spray Chlorpyriphos 20% EC @ 400 ml/acre. Dusting of Chlorpyriphos 1.5% D.P @ 10 kg/acre should be done uniformly during morning hours.
Sheath rot Management - Spray Carbendazim 25% EC @ 200 ml/acre or Iprodine 25% + Carbendazim 25% WP @ 500 ml/acre.
Leaf hopper - pyrilla and Mealy Bug Management - Spray Imidacloprid 17.8 % SL @ 60 ml/acre by mixing in 200 liters of water.
Reproductive stage - Control powdery mildew disease by treating seeds with Carbendazim @ 2 gram/kg.
Planting - Manage Fusarium wilt disease by draining excess water from field and applying Metalaxyl8%+Mancozeb64% WP @ 2 gram per litre of water.
Planting - Manage Fusarium wilt disease by draining excess water from field and applying Metalaxyl8%+Mancozeb64% WP @ 2 gram per litre of water.
Vegetative/Fruiting - Manage mealy bug infestation with neem-based pesticide or insecticidal soap.
Manage infestation in Goats - Spray 1% Assuntol or Malathion to eliminate mites.
